content: Uhhhhh...... I think this should be medium difficulty??

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun figuring out the pattern from the tests rather than being told exactly what to do.
Very cool puzzle, I liked it! üëç

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun playing with vectors and rotation matrixes, handling cases, determining what is the pattern and applying it, how the length of a side evolves...

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like this puzzle. Nice story and cover, and difficulty is good enough.

I like the puzzle. I am not in love with :The background and Scenario sections.

Background:
I don't want to be told to go watch a movie and hearing about someone else's exploits has nothing to do with this puzzle. I get that is what inspired you but it doesn't add anything to the puzzle. 
- possible solutions would be to give the movie a shout out but also give us a first person update to our epic alien riddle solving dilema.

This Scenario:
Why does it say another attempt? and 'as a potential-vehicle for some wild space-time multiverse travel adventures.'

-This kinda takes me out of the scenario as it just requires me to go watch a movie.
-I enjoy puzzles that are more stand alone. They give me everything i need to feel engaged in the write up.
-You can just let us know their intentions are a mystery.
Lisa have a lot of ideas

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun little puzzle, not complicated to figure out the instructions, lots of variety with all the test/validator associated.

Constraints section
* Is it correct to say that no wrap-around is necessary? That is, one will never reach the end of the alphabet in the middle of the spiral? If so, suggest to mention it in the Constraints section.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Thanks.
Ain't that the Truth (its a blessing and a curse)

Hi EdwigeE --
Thanks for the thorough feedback.

I definitely wasn't trying to say you have to watch this movie to solve the puzzle, but I can sorta see how that might have been inferred.

So I changed
(Maybe that worked, maybe not -- watch the movie; it's great.)
~to~ 
(Maybe that worked, maybe not; no spoilers here.)


And I changed
Here is another attempt at the aliens communicating how they want us Earthlings to build something
~to~
In a sequel to that story, the aliens once again attempt to communicate how they want us Earthlings to build something

I want to leave in "as a potential-vehicle for some wild space-time multiverse travel adventures" because that is what the device does in the movie.  If you don't know the movie, you can just ignore that, but it's a fun reminder-phrase for those in the know.

Is that better?

Oh, I thought we would never reach the end of the alphabet in the middle of the spiral, but there were actually such cases... Please move the newly added constraint to Goal section (as it's no longer a constraint). Thank you.
